string-array.name: recipe_1_ingredient
string-array.item: cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes
medium-sized onions, thinly sliced and fried until golden brown
Fresh coriander and mint leaves for garnish

string-array.name: recipe_2_ingredient
string-array.item: lb halal chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces

string-array.name: recipe_3_ingredient
string-array.item: lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces

string-array.name: recipe_5_ingredient
string-array.item: cups flat rice noodles, soaked and drained

string-array.name: recipe_3_instruction
string-array.item: In a bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup honey, and 2 tablespoons ketchup to make the sauce. Set aside.
In a large skillet or wok, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add 2 cloves of minced garlic and 1 teaspoon of grated ginger to the skillet. SautÃ© for about 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the bite-sized pieces of 1 pound of boneless, skinless chicken thighs to the skillet. Cook until the chicken is browned and cooked through.
Pour the prepared sauce over the cooked chicken and stir to coat evenly.
In a small bowl, mix 1 tablespoon of cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water to create a slurry. Add the slurry to the skillet and stir until the sauce thickens.
Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions if desired.
Serve the Honey Chicken over rice or noodles.

string-array.name: recipe_1_instruction
string-array.item: In a large bowl, mix together the yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Add the chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring they are well coated. Marinate for at least 2 hours or preferably overnight in the refrigerator.
In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add salt, bay leaves, cardamom pods, cloves, and cinnamon stick.
Add the rinsed rice to the boiling water and cook until it is 70-80% cooked. The rice should still have a bite to it. Drain the water and set aside.
In a large, heavy-bottomed pan or pot, heat oil or ghee over medium heat.
Add cumin seeds, bay leaves, cardamom pods, cloves, and cinnamon stick. SautÃ©
Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sautÃ© until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the oil starts to separate from the masala.
In the same pan with the masala, layer half of the partially cooked rice.
Place the marinated chicken over the rice.
Top with the remaining rice. Sprinkle fried onions, fresh coriander, and mint leaves over the rice.
Cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil or a lid.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld and the chicken to cook completely.
Once done, gently fluff the biryani with a fork, mixing the layers.
Serve hot, garnished with additional fried onions, fresh coriander, and mint leaves.

string-array.name: recipe_2_instruction
string-array.item: Cook the fettuccine pasta according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add 3 cloves of minced garlic and sautÃ© for about 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add 1 pound of halal chicken pieces to the skillet and cook until they are no longer pink in the center. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Pour in 1 cup of halal chicken broth and bring it to a simmer. Allow it to cook for a few minutes to reduce slightly.
Lower the heat and add 1 cup of heavy cream to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
Gradually sprinkle in 1 cup of grated Parmesan cheese, stirring constantly to melt and incorporate the cheese into the sauce. Continue stirring until the sauce is smooth and creamy.
Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.
Add the cooked fettuccine pasta to the skillet and toss until the pasta is coated evenly with the Alfredo sauce.
Serve the Halal Chicken Alfredo hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

string-array.name: recipe_4_instruction
string-array.item: Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the finely chopped shallots and minced garlic. SautÃ© until fragrant.
Push the shallots and garlic to one side of the wok, and pour the beaten eggs into the other side. Scramble the eggs until they are fully cooked.
Add the diced carrots, frozen peas, and shredded chicken to the wok. Stir-fry until the vegetables are tender.
Push the ingredients to the side of the wok, add a bit more oil if needed, and then add the cooled cooked jasmine rice. Stir-fry the rice until it is well combined with the other ingredients.
Combine soy sauce, sweet soy sauce, shrimp paste (if using), and white pepper. Pour the sauce over the rice and stir-fry to evenly coat the rice.
Garnish with sliced green onions and serve the Indonesian Fried Rice hot.

string-array.name: recipe_5_instruction
string-array.item: Soak the flat rice noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a wok or large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the minced garlic and cubed tofu. Stir-fry until the tofu is golden brown.
Push the tofu to one side of the wok and pour the lightly beaten egg into the other side. Scramble the egg until it is fully cooked.
Add the soaked and drained rice noodles to the wok, followed by bean sprouts and cooked shrimp. Stir-fry until well combined.
In a small bowl, mix fish sauce, tamarind paste, and sugar. Pour the sauce over the noodle mixture and stir-fry until everything is evenly coated.
Sprinkle crushed peanuts over the Pad Thai and toss to combine.
Serve the Pad Thai hot, garnished with lime wedges and chopped cilantro.

string-array.name: recipe_6_instruction
string-array.item: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, white vinegar, water, brown sugar, minced garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and salt to make the marinade.

Place chicken thighs and drumsticks in a large bowl or resealable plastic bag. Pour the marinade over the chicken, ensuring its well-coated. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or overnight for best results.
In a large skillet or pot, place the marinated chicken along with the marinade. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 30-40 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked and tender.
Remove the lid and continue to simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes to allow the sauce to thicken.
Remove bay leaves and discard them. Serve the Chicken Adobo hot over cooked white rice.

string-array.name: recipe_7_instruction
string-array.item: Fill a large, shallow saucepan with about 2 inches of water. Add white vinegar and salt to the water and bring it to a simmer over medium heat.
While the water is heating, toast the English muffin halves and cook the Canadian bacon in a separate pan until lightly browned.

Once the water is simmering, create a gentle whirlpool in the center with a spoon. Carefully crack one egg into a small bowl and gently slide it into the swirling water. Repeat with the other egg. Poach the eggs for about 3 minutes for a soft yolk.
Using a slotted spoon, carefully lift each poached egg out of the water and drain excess water on a paper towel.
Assemble the Eggs Benedict by placing the toasted English muffin halves on a plate. Top each half with sautÃ©ed spinach, a slice of Canadian bacon, and a poached egg.
Drizzle Hollandaise sauce over the poached eggs.
Garnish with chopped fresh chives and a sprinkle of black pepper.
Serve the Eggs Benedict immediately and enjoy!

string-array.name: recipe_8_ingredient
string-array.item: pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
cup cashew nuts, soaked and blended into a paste

string-array.name: recipe_8_instruction
string-array.item: In a bowl, marinate the chicken with yogurt, turmeric powder, chili powder, and garam masala. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add finely chopped onions and sautÃ© until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste to the skillet and cook for another 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the marinated chicken to the skillet. Cook until the chicken is browned and cooked through.
Stir in tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in the heavy cream and cashew nut paste. Stir well to combine.
Season with sugar and salt to taste. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve the Butter Chicken hot over rice or with naan.

string-array.name: recipe_9_ingredient
string-array.item: lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces

string-array.name: recipe_9_instruction
string-array.item: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, sake, mirin, minced garlic, grated ginger, and sugar to make the marinade.
Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces and marinate them in the sauce for at least 30 minutes.
In a separate bowl, coat the marinated chicken with potato starch (or cornstarch) and all-purpose flour.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large skillet to 350Â°F (180Â°C).
Fry the coated chicken pieces in batches until golden brown and cooked through, about 5-6 minutes per batch.
Remove the chicken from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve the Chicken Karaage hot with your favorite dipping sauce.
Enjoy your crispy and delicious Chicken Karaage!

string-array.name: recipe_10_ingredient
string-array.item: block firm tofu, cut into small cubes
tablespoons cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water (for thickening)

string-array.name: recipe_10_instruction
string-array.item: In a bowl, mix together soy sauce, chili bean paste, and minced fermented black beans. Set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add minced ginger, minced garlic, and crushed Sichuan peppercorns. Stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add ground beef to the wok and cook until browned.
Pour the soy sauce mixture into the wok and stir well to coat the beef.
Add chicken or beef broth to the wok and bring to a simmer.
Gently add the cubed tofu to the wok and simmer for 5-7 minutes, allowing the tofu to absorb the flavors.
Stir in the cornstarch-water mixture to thicken the sauce.
Season with sugar and sesame oil. Stir to combine.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve the Beef Mapo Tofu hot over rice.
Enjoy your flavorful and spicy Beef Mapo Tofu!
